subject: Education
title: Attribution Theory: How We Explain Success and Failure
description: A short lesson to help you apply Attribution Theory: How We Explain Success and Failure.

hook.text: You failed a test. Was it because you're dumb, didn't study, or the test was unfair?

buildup.text: Attribution theory examines how people explain outcomes: internal vs. external, stable vs. unstable.

discovery.text: Attributing failure to effort (unstable, controllable) protects motivation. Attributing it to ability (stable) kills it.

twist.text: Teachers' attributions about students become self-fulfilling prophecies through differential treatment.

climax.text: Teaching students to reattribute failure to strategy and effort transforms their persistence.

punchline.text: The story you tell about failure writes the next chapter of your success.

quiz.question: Which attribution for failure best preserves motivation?
options: Attributing it to insufficient effort or poor strategy
Attributing it to low natural ability
Blaming the teacher or the test
